title: Curvy 'e'
content:
I can’t find an actual specimen of this font, so I created a rough approximation. I’ve seen this ’e’ in a spa’s name, among other places. Its bar is a curve that begins to the left of the rest of the letter, like so:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503105950im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wtf_3419.png)

Only it’s more elegant than that. The curve tapers to a point, and I believe the other end of the ’e’ does as well. Any ideas?
author: pdxuser
